summary:
Yale University, located in New Haven, Connecticut, is a prestigious private university founded in 1701. It's one of the oldest schools in the U.S. and was first called the Collegiate School. Initially, it taught theology and sacred languages, but later expanded to include humanities and sciences. In the 1800s, Yale started offering graduate and professional programs.

Today, Yale has 14 schools, including the famous Yale Law School. It has a huge endowment, one of the largest in the world, and an impressive library with over 15 million books. Yale students, known as Bulldogs, excel in sports and academics. Many famous people, including 5 U.S. presidents and 65 Nobel laureates, are Yale alumni.
title: Yale University
